title: Cheese Omelette Recipe
description: This cheese omelette is light, tender, and fluffy, made with 3 eggs and filled with buttery Emmentaler cheese for an easy omelette to make at home.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Eggs Omelet Recipes Cheese Omelette 4.7 (17) 13 Reviews 3 Photos This cheese omelette is great for breakfast. My husband loves omelettes and nothing makes him happier. When cooking an omelette, it's important that you keep the temperature on the low side, as you don't want it to turn brown. Submitted by topfgucker Updated on November 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 1 Yield: 1 omelette Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 3 large eggs 1 tablespoon milk, or as needed salt and freshly ground white pepper to taste 2 tablespoons butter ¼ cup shredded Emmentaler cheese Directions Whisk eggs in a bowl; add milk and season with salt and white pepper. Whisk until egg mixture is foamy, 2 to 3 minutes. Melt butter in a small, nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Pour in egg mixture and swirl the skillet, so the bottom is evenly covered with egg. Cook until egg starts to set, about 1 minute. Lift edges with a spatula and tilt the skillet so uncooked egg can flow towards the bottom of the skillet to set. Repeat until no visible liquid egg remains. Carefully flip omelette; cook until warmed through, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Sprinkle Emmentaler cheese down the middle of omelette; fold in half. Cook until cheese is melted, about 20 seconds. Slide omelette onto a plate. Cook’s Note You can use any cheese in this omelette; we just love Emmentaler cheese. I Made It Print 62 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Cheese Omelette 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 03 Photo by  TxCin2 10/09/2024 Easy peasy eggs over cheesy. This was simple, fast, and filling. I used a medium cheddar cheese for mine. The only trouble I had was when I was trying to lift the edge so the uncooked egg could run beneath and it tore because I lifted the edge a little too much trying to get more tilt so the egg would run easier, so my omelet wasn't pretty. I tried to fix it with the uncooked egg, but when I went to flip it, it was all over. So scrambled egg with cheese it is. I formed it back into an omelet shape the best I could. Do use a large bowl to whisk the eggs as I used a regular cereal bowl and while it worked, I had to be cautious while whisking, and a larger bowl would have just been much easier. I'd also pull out the hand mixer instead of hand whisking for those few minutes. Any cheese you like will work in this and this is easy to customize to your preference by adding whatever filling you'd like. 1 You’ll Also Love Simple Italian Omelet 42 Ratings Cheese Omelette with Herbs 1 Rating Buffalo Wings and Blue Cheese Omelet Ultimate Low-Carb Ham and Cheese Omelet for Two 2 Ratings Greek Omelet with Asparagus and Feta Cheese 27 Ratings Japanese Sweet Omelet 6 Ratings Tamagoyaki (Japanese Sweet Omelet) 9 Ratings Keto Buffalo Chicken Omelette 1 Rating Ham and Cheese Omelette 11 Ratings Baby Spinach Omelet 379 Ratings Creamy Cottage Cheese Scrambled Eggs 184 Ratings Western Omelet 4 Ratings Easy Omelet in a Bag 28 Ratings Mushroom, Scallion, and Cheese Omelet 12 Ratings Candice's Lasagna Omelet 2 Ratings Sriracha Scrambled Eggs 26 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Lift edges with a spatula and tilt the skillet so uncooked egg can flow towards the bottom of the skillet to set. Cook until cheese is melted, about 20 seconds. Slide omelette onto a plate.
